text:
I'm really sorry for the late reply. This week has been ridiculously hectic moving back and forth from home to uni a lot. Your journey sounds incredibly interesting! It must have taught you a lot in such a short space of time moving from vfx to animation!

I got interested in 3D modelling first, just by looking at 3D and VFX artists online such as Andreas Wannderstedt and I was lucky enough to be able to take a UAL interactive media diploma at college, I got to use Maya and a wide variety of other 3d/games related units as well as some design ones. It felt like the natural next step was to create characters in 3D and/or animate them to tell stories
Was it intimidating for you to move from rigging to animation or was it something more natural? :slightly_smiling_face:
